com.absio.file

Class OFS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.file.OFS

  • public class OFS
extends Object
    This class represents an obfuscated file system (OFS) located in a directory on the host file system. Within the OFS, file and directory names are obfuscated to prevent external identification of data. Files within the OFS are located based on deterministic hashing of a random or static seed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static OFS create(Path baseDirectoryPath)
      Creates and populates the file system.
      static OFS create(Path baseDirectoryPath, String subDirectorySeed)
      Creates and populates the file system.
      void createRootDirectories()
      Creates the root directories of the OFS.
      Path getHashedPath(String fileSeed)
      Gets a deterministic hashed file path in the OFS directory.
      Path getRootPath()
      Gets the root path initialized with this OFS instance.
      Path getUnusedHashedPath()
      Finds a random, unused hashed file path in the OFS directory.
      void wipeDirectory()
      Deletes the OFS directory and all underlying data associated with the initialized settings.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static OFS create(Path baseDirectoryPath)
                  throws IOException,
                         NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates and populates the file system. The root path of the OFS will be created from based on the base directory.
        Parameters:
        baseDirectoryPath - the root directory path
        Returns:
        the OFS instance
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs accessing the file system
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if a hash was unable to be generated

      • create

        public static OFS create(Path baseDirectoryPath,
                         String subDirectorySeed)
                  throws IOException,
                         NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates and populates the file system. The root path of the OFS will be created from a combination of the base directory and a hash of the sub-directory seed.
        Parameters:
        baseDirectoryPath - the root directory path
        subDirectorySeed - seed for obfuscating the base directory
        Returns:
        the OFS instance
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs accessing the file system
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if a hash was unable to be generated

      • createRootDirectories

        public void createRootDirectories()
                           throws IOException
        Creates the root directories of the OFS.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs accessing the file system

      • getHashedPath

        public Path getHashedPath(String fileSeed)
                   throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Gets a deterministic hashed file path in the OFS directory.
        Parameters:
        fileSeed - the static seed to locate the file
        Returns:
        the hashed Path instance
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if a hash was unable to be generated

      • getRootPath

        public Path getRootPath()
        Gets the root path initialized with this OFS instance.
        Returns:
        the instance root path

      • getUnusedHashedPath

        public Path getUnusedHashedPath()
                         throws IOException,
                                NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Finds a random, unused hashed file path in the OFS directory.
        Returns:
        path to a nonexistent file within the OFS
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs accessing the file system
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if a hash was unable to be generated

      • wipeDirectory

        public void wipeDirectory()
                   throws IOException
        Deletes the OFS directory and all underlying data associated with the initialized settings.

        WARNING: This operation cannot be undone. Makes sure you really want to delete all files and directories associated with the OFS.

        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while deleting the directory
